item.title: Alsha add a quote by E.M. Forster
item.description: "It isn't possible to love and part. You will wish that it was. You can transmute love, ignore it, muddle it, but you can never pull it out of you. I know by experience that the poets are right: love is eternal." -- E.M. Forster

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Mary Roach
item.description: "The nobility of the human spirit grows harder for me to believe in. War, zealotry, greed, malls, narcissism. I see a backhanded nobility in excessive, impractical outlays of cash prompted by nothing loftier than a species joining hands and saying “I bet we can do this.” Yes, the money could be better spent on Earth. But would it? Since when has money saved by government red-lining been spent on education and cancer research? It is always squandered. Let’s squander some on Mars. Let’s go out and play." -- Mary Roach

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "All stories are lies. But good stories are lies made from light and fire. And they lift our hearts out of the dust, and out of the grave." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "When a book is read an irrevocable thing happens — a murder, followed by an imposture. The story in the mind murders the story on the page, and takes its place." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description: "Be yourself, until you bleed." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Mike Carey
item.description:
"<b>Yahweh:</b> You've been unhappy because you've desired things that cannot be.
<b>Lucifer:</b> That's what desire IS. The need for what we can't have. The need for what's readily available is called greed." -- Mike Carey

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "Bigger questions, questions with more than one answer, questions without an answer are the hardest to cope with in silence. Once asked they do not evaporate and leave the mind to its serener musings. Once asked they gain dimension and texture, trip you on the stairs, wake you at night-time. A black hole sucks up its surroundings and even light never escapes. Better then to ask no questions? Better then to be a contented pig than an unhappy Socrates? Since factory farming is tougher on pigs than it is on philosophers I'll take a chance." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Austin Kleon
item.description: "Collect books, even if you don't plan on reading them right away. Nothing is more important than an unread library." -- Austin Kleon

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Nobody looks like what they really are on the inside. You don’t. I don’t. People are much more complicated than that. It’s true of everybody." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Rachel Hartman
item.description: "We were all monsters and bastards, and we were all beautiful." -- Rachel Hartman

item.title: Alsha add a quote by Frances Hardinge
